I did something quite similar at the time but the rails app and the ember app were the same
one question, what happens when the user transitions from a non-ember section to an ember-section?
it performs a full reload?
and ember loads from scratch?

Well, the request would be made to the Rails server for the page, as it would have anyway….And if the requesting route is an emberified route, then the ember layout will be returned….So yeh, ember app would then load……We need to be smart in the way we decide which features to port and in which order…..And it’s early days so the real answer to your question is, we’ll see I guess.
But I envisage that we will be porting features on a page by page basis, as opposed to features within a page…..Will see how it pans out I guess….
I did something that you might find helpful to avoid the reloading
that it's the best/only good uses case of turbolinks I am aware of
when you load the javascript, you create your ember app in a node and then your keep a reference to that node
when you are in ember everything works ok
when you click in a link to a non-ember route, you detach that node from the DOM but you keep the application alive
and when you go back to an ember section
you add the node to the dom again
and your app has the same state
the perceived speed is great because you don't need to boot the ember app each time
